captions.text:
Las Vegas is situated in the United States
in the western state of Nevada.
Rising like an oasis from the Mojave Desert,

this city of over 1,000,000 people enjoys
300 days of sunshine a year.
"Hey buddy, would ya pass me the suntan lotion?"

If ever there was a city that shouldn't be,
it's Las Vegas.

Starting life as a windswept watering hole
on the Pioneer Trail,

this is a city that continually beat the odds.
Over the decades,

Las Vegas grew into a kinda neon Camelot,
whose casinos and Rat Pack style
has become almost legendary;

but if your ideas about Las Vegas look like
an old Super 8 movie,
prepare to be blown away.
And I mean really blown away.
This is not just a city.

The Las Vegas of the 21st century is like
visiting another planet -
A Pleasure Planet!
It's a total escapist fantasy.

Everyone is here for a good time, from Grandma
Joe to movie stars - "hey! isn't that...?".
Whatever you want, you can have it here.

Looking for a taste of classic Vegas, Daddy
O?

Head Downtown to Fremont Street and into a
world of old school cocktail lounges,
piano bars and classic casinos.
Okay. Now it's time to hit The Strip.

If everything's big in Vegas, it's a hundred
times bigger here.

We're not talking casinos anymore, we're talkin'
mythical cities -

whole worlds geared around you having the
time of your life.

Whatever mood floats your boat, you'll find
it here.
Fancy three days of unbelievable indulgence?

Say "buongiorno" to the Bellagio and her incredible
dancing fountains.

Step back in time at the Luxor or Caesars
Palace.

This is what Ancient Egypt and Rome might
have been like

if they'd discovered electricity and cocktails
(or happy hours) a little sooner.
Feeling more tropically inclined?

Kick off those heels and feel the sand between
your toes
at The Mirage and Mandalay Bay resorts.
The resorts on the Strip are so vast and self-contained,

it's possible to land in one and not step
outside again for the rest of your stay.

But you will step out and explore the unique
themes of at least a few others,

sampling the incredible shows, dining, and
shopping experiences each one has to offer.

If this neon paradise still ain't enough for
you,
Mother Nature has a few surprises of her own.
That is, if you can find your way out!

The Valley of Fire is just 50 miles out of
town,

and the Grand Canyon is a half-a-day drive
away.
But as nighttime descends,

Vegas calls like an incredible cluster of
neon jewels under the desert sky.
Las Vegas dazzles like no other city.

She's here to remind us that we're here on
Earth, not for a long time,
but for a good time!

And Las Vegas will be the best time you ever
had.

fantastic.﻿

comments.text:
Las Vegas
Tanto si sos un gran apostador o un visitante mesurado, Las Vegas tiene 
algo para satisfacer tu gusto de vacaciones. Con una muestra de los mejores 
chefs y abundantes bufés, probá tu suerte en uno de los casinos más 
importantes del mundo o participá de un show espectacular. Un simple paseo 
por la zona es suficiente para que tu corazón bombee. Una vez que tuviste 
suficiente alboroto, saludá a la dientuda vida marina del arrecife de 
tiburones de la Bahía Mandalay, subí al Gran Cañón del Colorado o visitá el 
Museo de neón, donde las señales antiguas adquieren nueva vida.﻿

+TheBrunsesFilms Production You obviously know nothing about this place. 
The city of Las Vegas is part of a township called Las Vegas Township. It 
includes Las Vegas and 6 other towns making the population around 1.4

which is home to 2 million people. There are no other metropolitan areas in 
Clark County.

comments.author: Gr8 Travel Tips

comments.text:
Been to Vegas twice. It's pretty fun, but in my opinion it's one of those 
places that just looks much cooler than it actually is to be there. Don't 
get me wrong, it's definately worth to visit. If you're not a huge 
party-person, you won't magically transform into to one just by going 
there. 

If you're not that into gambling, there are still great shows to see or 
other activities outside. First time I was there I took one of those 
helicopter tours into the Grand Canyon. They land right before sunset and 
flies you back and over the strip when it's dark so you can see all the 
lights from the sky. Expensive (about 300 dollars), but totally worth it.

You can also rent sports cars for a decent price and cruise around on the 
long desert roads. If you go for an American car like, Dodge Viper it's 
usually 1/3 of the price you'd pay for a Ferrari or Porsche. ﻿
comments.author: Froudini

comments.text:
Well Duh, lol. That's because Vegas is in a Valley. (Thus, the name of the 
metropolitan area) You can't build a city over 40 miles of rocks and trees. 
I may be biased because I grew up here but I understand that there is lots 
to do in the desert (Hiking, Mountain biking, watching the sunset, etc) And 
whether there's vegetation or not, I believe anyone can learn to appreciate 
the natural beauty of the desert.
comments.author: Wizz101andTTI

comments.text:
Yes, but that is northwest of Vegas, that isn't IN Vegas. Arizona has 
Cactus' at least. If you want nature, the Grand Canyon is the place to go. 
Sorry but I just dont find Vegas that appealing. Yes it's fun and a good 
weekend visit, but I just feel that it's overrated and overhyped.
comments.author: B!tch-U-Out

comments.text:
+ofelixdacat I really don't find the area much different from Phoenix, 
Arizona. Besides, you may not realize but just a few miles northwest of Las 
Vegas is the Spring Mountains, which are snowcapped in the winter, and are 
the reason the city exists (because of the snow runoff) The high point is 
Mt. Charleston which is close to 12,000 ft tall. It's also the highest 
mountain in the region (The Mojave Desert) Just pay a little more attention 
on your plain ride. Southern Nevada is awesome.
comments.author: Wizz101andTTI

comments.text:
+Wizz101andTTI .  The city is all lights and concrete and steel. Not much 
nature at all. The dessert around the city is all rocks and tumbleweed. The 
only "nature" in Vegas are the man made gardens at the casinos.  Sorry, but 
Vegas isn't the city to go to if you want to see nature or spectacular 
natural landscapes.
